doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 20 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 137 [Air Date: 2/12/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 20 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 137 [Air Date: 2/12/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. New chairman of Democratic Party, Paul G. Kirk Junior, approves the removal of the caucus system, a gay/lesbian political conduitCOMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals2. Interview with Jeff Snow and Bonnie McGinley, spokepersons for Concerned Americans for Individual RightsCOMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper3. Philadelphia Commission on Human Relations/military Recruitment Conflict at Temple University4. Gay employment rights referendum does not pass in Houston, Texas, interview with Debra Danbury, state representative of Houston District #137COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"5. 5th circuit of appeals reviews sodomy law that only includes homosexuals in Austin, Texas6. Openly gay and closeted politiciansCOMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store7. Sports8. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Joyce Hunter, Program Director at Institute For the Protection of Lesbian & Gay Youth, discusses shelters and counseling9. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1.Opening with Sybil Opthalmia BruncheonCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine2. Flower arrangements with Sybil Opthalmia BruncheonCOMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store3. Culture/media/current eventsCOMMERCIAL: World of Video4. Interview with The Women of DallasCOMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Mike Farrell 5. On the streets with John Seidner6. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 20 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 137 [Air Date: 2/12/1985]: February 1985
